title: Fantastic app but stopped working :(
comment: Fantastic app, I use it all the time. But since the 4.4 update it will not connect. Just hangs on "Waiting..." status. Will give 5 stars if fixed...

title: Love Its Features, But One Very Annoying Bug
comment: 9/16/2013: Latest version doesn't seem to work.  It either doesn't respond to presses on "Connect" or it's stuck on "Waiting..."   I love GTalkSMS (<3 CLI), and I bought the donate app.  But there's one very annoying bug, which happens on my old and new phone: often when the phone switches from wifi to mobile data or vice versa, GTalkSMS won't be able to reconnect to GTalk.  It's stuck in a loop or something.  It'd require a force kill and restart.
Fantastically useful!

title: Awesome!
comment: So this is one of the best apps I've discovered. You should set up a different gmail just for this so you don't always show up online...Texting is so much faster...even if I leave my phone home I can still use it!!! Thanks to the developer...  Read up on the faqs they have online if you have issues...works great I use my google account but use IMO to log in.

title: Camera is not working
comment: Using for quite some time. Very handy and a must have app. The latest update does not allow me to take/email photo remotely. Didn't have this problem till ver4.2.

title: Didn't connect
comment: Well at least I wasted my time installing this and setting up a jabber account justri have this attempt and never work. Yes I checkedmy setting and the domain. But it just spun the circle at me. Weak.

We are sorry that GTalkSMS didn't work for you. Most people don't have any major problems with the app and we are always happy to help you. The gtalksms-users group ( https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups#!forum/gtalksms-users ) is a good place to ask for guidance/support.

title: A must have if you use the gmail web interface and chrome
comment: I use the gmail web interface as my main desktop mail client, which of course has Google talk built in. I'm also using the chrome browser, which supports desktop notifications. So without installing any software on my PC I can now send, receive and reply to SMS messages. Works brilliantly.   One thing that would be good is if gtalkSMS could support other notification types, other than just calls and SMS. Then it would get 6 stars!

title: Slow
comment: Takes up to 2 minutes to reply to commands

title: Really helpful to reply
comment: The app is really useful when you are in front of a computer. It is really easy to read received messages and reply to them. But unless I have the exact phone number or contact name with a single number, I'm finding it little difficult to send a new message. Or I'm missing some commands.

title: Amazing
comment: One of the most useful apps in this place. Definitely the easiest way to text from your computer. And you can use it through imessage on your Mac! Sweeet.

title: I love it
comment: Very useful app. I mainly use it for sms sending and contact managment, and it implements an idea I had for a moment now: integrate sms in my IM client. Now that empathy is so well integrated in gnome via Gnome-shell under Linux, it has become a very easy way to send sms almost seamlessly. I was using SMS2PC and other similar apps before, but this one overtakes them all, with its simple but flexible concept and with its ubiquity. No need of wifi anymore, no need of yet-another-specific-proprietary software on your computer. It just works, whatever your platform, on your pc or on the go, wherever you are given that your phone has got internet. It's simple, interoperable and very effective, the way I like them :)  A request: pleaaaaase, add commands to control the music playback! thanks!

title: Love it!
comment: Was using talk2phone before I found this but it was very slow at times and gave you a giant jumble of text when you got a message. This is so much better! It's faster, has more commands, and recognizes contacts unlike talk2phone.

title: Login Issues
comment: I am not able to login... I am frquently trying to access but it's always saying INVALID USER ID AND PASSWORD...

title: @Santhosh
comment: It does NOT per se ask for the password of your normal Gmail account; the developers recommend you to make a new Gmail or Jabber account with which the app can chat to your normal Gmail or Jabber. :-) It is explained in the documentation. This app is very useful! :-)

title: great concept, not-so-great execution
comment: Always locks up after a command fails, you have to kill it manually from the apps list.

title: why prompting for password?
comment: the app is asking me to put my gmail username and password, can't the Android account manager be used to retrieve my information. I see similar apps such as Talk2Phone or Desksms, they don't prompt me for my user name and password. Overall, this is a nice idea.

title: One of the Most Useful Apps
comment: I've never written an app review before, but this is by far one of the most useful apps I have ever encountered.  There are several others that do similar things, but I find myself usually using this one.  I highly recommend this to everyone with an Android.  My only criticism is that the name could be a little more appropriate/accurate.
Great application! Highly recommend it.

title: Perfect
comment: Ultra-light and complete application to control remotly one's phone !  Thanks to XMPP-based chat, you can send SMS discreetly from the GMail web interfacee for example.  The ring command is very useful when you loose your phone, as it make it ring out loud (regardless of your phone volume).

title: Works wonderfully!
comment: Great app that does what it says it does, and does it well! I've used it for over a year without any problems up until the previous update which suddenly had tons of force close issues, but the newest update quickly fixed those problems and it is now back to running smoothly.
I like the new interface!

comment: Since the April 2 release, public intents cannot be received from external applications.

title: Gtalk
comment: Love it

title: Nifty little app
comment: I had previously toyed with the idea of remote control, but it doesn't work if i do not root my Galaxy S2 and i couldn't get a incoming connection with my 3G plan. I am now using gtalksms to access my phone during the times when i do not have access to it.   The idea of using a Instant Messaging framework alleviates itself from hosting expensive servers, and allows users to access their phone from any desktop. That's nifty.  Good app that deserved a donation from me.  Do keep up the good work and i hope this app runs smoothly on ICS when the update comes for Galaxy S2. :)

title: Extremely useful!
comment: I've been using this app since it first came out and it has become simply indispensable on every Android device I've had.  Use it every day at home and work.  Great job!

title: One of the best app ever
comment: No longer do I need to keep my phone near and worry about radiation. Can send receive sms from my im client. To get the full usefulness create separate im account.

title: Best around
comment: Great app, I use this at the office with my gmail chat open. I love how there is so little configuration required (no fiddling with IP addresses). If only you could reduce power consumption :)

title: Fantastic App
comment: This app is an example of what Android wants to allow and enable. Great app especially for it allowing so many features for free. Only suggestion I have is not to send notifications to the account that you use with GTalk on your phone. If you do, you'll get a SMS, a notification is sent to your account, and then you receive a GTalk notification back on your phone (thus notifying you twice). Not a bug of the app, just an odd occurrence.
Great App. Working on N1. Try restarting phone if you get password error. Step by step guide available on GTalkSMS wiki.
Works great. I donated by installing the donation key.
Really bad UI. I should be welcomed by some setup wizard.
